title: UK general election poll tracker: Latest party odds and polling results in full
text:
Britain is gearing up for a pre-Christmas election where Jeremy Corbyn will take on Boris Johnson in a race to lead the UK - weeks before Brexit on January 31.

The Tories have enjoyed a bounce in the polls in late 2019 while Labour struggled to compete with resurgent Lib Dems.

At the start of the campaign the Tories were odds-on to win. But the 2017 election saw Labour surge back to cut down a huge Tory lead with days to spare, so strategists believe anything is possible.

That election also saw the two main parties receive 84% of all votes. Since then - with Brexit tearing up old loyalties - polls suggest the electorate isn't going to back the big parties in quite the same way as it did for most of the last 50 years.

So what exactly do the polls tell us about what will happen in a general election and who is on track to win if their is a snap election before the end of the year?

Here's what you need to know.
description: Britain is gearing up for a December general election in a showdown over Brexit. Here is what the latest polls and odds say about Labour, the Conservatives and more
